subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] new font released
msgSnippet: ... Yikes! That makes no sense. I don t have any idea what is going on. I have used the font in both linux and Mac OS. I have not used it extensively. Are you
messageBody:
pgabhart wrote:
>
>
> Paul:
>
> I downloaded and installed Thoth. I think the shapes of the letters
> look very good at first sight. There are a couple of weird things
> happening though, and I'm not sure what is causing it. When I type
> "I-t" and then space, the letter is changing to "E-at." Also, when I
> typed the word "don't" and then space, the vowel changes to "O-n." and
> an apostrophe appears between the n and t. Does this make any sense?
>
> In any event, congratulations on a fine new addition to QS fonts.
>

Yikes! That makes no sense. I don't have any idea what is going on. I
have used the font in both linux and Mac OS. I have not used it
extensively. Are you sure there is not some spell correction working in
the background? What program are you using?

By the way, you mean not Thoth and not Thoth Unicode?

Paul
